text: How can I include a simple point on my graph using Plots.jl?

elements.text: How can I include a simple point on my graph using Plots.jl?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
I have a graph but I am just trying to add an array of points. Can I hard code it?

elements.text: I have a graph but I am just trying to add an array of points. Can I hard code it?

text: Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/57058| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

You mean like
```# Plot something
plot(...)
# Add some points
plot!(1:10, 1:10, seriestype=:scatter)```
?

elements.text:

plot(...)

plot!(1:10, 1:10, seriestype=:scatter)

text: yeah I have a plot set up using Plot!, but when I add `plot!(-120,36,, color=:blue, markersize = 2, legend = false)`  nothing happens

elements.text: yeah I have a plot set up using Plot!, but when I add

text:
Oh, try
```plot!([-120],[36], color=:blue, markersize = 2, legend = false)```
instead — plots expects arrays
can i make an array x and y and include that? for multiple points
